website_summaries.verdict: This 3-blade fixed broadhead features a distinct right-helix design for unmatched stability and accuracy.
pros: Boasts trocar-tip, razor-sharp blades with solid steel ferrule
Designed to provide field-point-like accuracy as well as lethal performance on game
Engineered for exceptional toughness and dependability
cons: Blades sometimes come loose inside the broadhead
Less accurate than many comparable options

customer_reviews.title: Muzzy Brodheads
customer_reviews.text: I have been using muzzy broadheads for years they have never let me down. Opening day of bow season I took this 10 point, hands-down the best Brodhead you can get!
customer_reviews.author: zzr1200

customer_reviews.title: Good Broadhead
customer_reviews.text: These little broadheads fly great from my crossbow. They don't seem to have any negative effect on the bolt's flight. All three shot true on quality bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Flurry

customer_reviews.title: FLY PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: I’ve taken two deer this year with these and gold tip arrows. They fly great, I did not make any adjustment with my sight and they are within an inch or two of my practice tips. Only complaint would be that with both deer I did not have a great blood trails in the beginning. Both didn’t go too far but not as much blood as I would of liked in the first 30 yards.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure there is a better broadhead, especially for the money. For me, the Trocars fly darn close to my field points - i just need to make a slight x axis adjustment on my sight and I am in business. The Broadsheads are sturdy and are razor sharp. I'll admit. I occasionally get sucked in to buying other broads heads as a result of their marketing and hype. The same scenario plays out every time though: i unpack them. shoot them a few times at my foam targets, immediately revert back to the Muzzy's.
customer_reviews.author: FlufferButter

customer_reviews.title: Flys great,  Muzzy strong and devastating.
customer_reviews.text: I've gone full circle with broadheads over the last 25 years. And after less than acceptable results with mechanical heads I've come back home to Muzzy. These new Muzzy heads fly as good as any mechanical are stronger and just as devastating. Eliminating one possible point of failure in bow hunting should be everyone's first goal.
customer_reviews.author: R.W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice boardhead at first
customer_reviews.text: Nice boardhead, and very sharp. I shoot #70 bow after one shot in a test session, through a BLOCK Foam target the edges on the blades were chipped, bent and in bad shape. Couldn't believe it myself. I shot two more to see what would happen, and the 2nd had 50% damage on the blades, and they 3rd was 20-30% damage. Definitely not good for my target, test and Elk in my opinion. Bummer too, I thought they would be good... I'll stick with old, expensive, and proven Iron Will or G5
customer_reviews.author: Dereck Fandel

customer_reviews.title: Muzzy is the best
customer_reviews.text: Best fixed blade I have ever used. Accurate, quiet, and great value. Most fixed blades I have shot make my arrow drop more and I have to re adjust my sight. With these I did not, they fly just like my field tips.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Great flight
customer_reviews.text: Nice broadheads they fly great out to 40 yards no problem. At 50 yards I was getting about a 1 inch flight slightly right but definitely not an issue. And at 60 yards I was getting 1 inch low and right grouping. Wasn't even enough of a worry to adjust my rest so I let them be.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tried and liked better than others!
customer_reviews.text: Tried something new and fell in love. Had mechanical and just wanted to try something a little different. These were on point with my practice tips. Never had to adjust anything to start shooting these. Good cut and highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: I really like these broadheads
customer_reviews.text: I really like these broadheads. Mine did not shoot the same as my field tips, they shot about 4-5" lower. It made it kind of a pain to get them dialed in. They are dialed in now and work great. First deer I got with these was a complete pass through, in one side out the other. Really good blood trail, deer dropped 30-40 yds from the shot. These will be what I use from here on out I like them.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Steinkirchner

customer_reviews.title: Great broadhead for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I harvested a buck October 29th with One of these broadheads on a carbon express arrow. The shot placement was good, and the broadhead did it’s job. Complete pass through out the opposite shoulder area. The buck ran 60 yards and dropped in a cut corn field. After cleaning the broadhead it looks brand new. These few just like my field points. I would buy these again!
customer_reviews.author: David T Howard

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I have switched to these from the original Muzzy's. They have flown just as good as the others but seem to be holding up much better. I have had no problem with flight when compared with the field points.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hamar

customer_reviews.title: Bow chicka wow wow
customer_reviews.text: Hit a bull elk at 25yrds broadside with 400grain 29”dl 75lb dw double lung. No pass through. I'll be going with a heavier arrow next year but definitely using these again
customer_reviews.author: Mike Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Flys true as my field points. Shot this one went 20 yards and she was done for. I will not ever buy another broadhead
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan Ketterman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent broadhead
customer_reviews.text: Excellent broadhead. Flies like field tips. Had a pass through on a 6pt bull this season. Excellent blood trail - went 35 yds.
customer_reviews.author: IDbowhunter

customer_reviews.title: great buy.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, Muzzy Trocar is the go-to fixed blade.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer C

customer_reviews.title: Devastating!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used these broadheads the past 2 seasons and they will definitely be in my quiver this season as well!!! When I first got these thing I was really scratching my head and concerned that they would be to small. They have the smallest diameter I have ever seen. Don't be fooled!!!! These heads are extremely accurate (= to my field tips) due to there smaller diameter, but when it impacts makes a nice wide channel with amazing results. I have had 100% pass throughs using my Bow Tech Assassin @ 20 yards!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Lipari

customer_reviews.title: Muzzy Trocar did its job well
customer_reviews.text: Shot a wild boar with a muzzy not knowing how it would perform and was pleasantly surprised at the penetrating power of a 100 grain broadhead. Hit two ribs and had no problems with deflection, breakage, etc. Complete pass through at 40 yards, with hitting both ribs - broke through with no problem. Muzzy did its job well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Penetrate
customer_reviews.text: Wow just shot them out of my tenpoint. Exact same hit as field points. Look very rugged. Can't wait to see blood on the ground! I shot expandables for a while - not impressed sticking with fixed blade.
customer_reviews.author: Claybuster

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to tune for accuracy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for the upcoming archery season. My field points shot and grouped in a good pattern. As soon as I put the muzzy's on the arrow, all the arrows shot left 3-4 inches. I adjusted the sight appropriately to correct this and the accuracy just got worse. Got so frustrated I bought a completely different broad head set up.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Good deal!
customer_reviews.text: These may seem a little small but they do the job. Did not have to search far for the deer after they were shot and the blood trail was pretty easy to find. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Great fixed blade broadheads
customer_reviews.text: These broadheads really do shoot like field tips. They group well and don't seem to make noise like other fixed blades. Blades are razor sharp and actuall hold up well considering the thin profile. I haven't yet tested them on big game but feel confident they would perform well.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Sharp!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very good broad heads for my crossbow. Have bought 6. Should last me awhile.
customer_reviews.author: jimmy

customer_reviews.title: ONLY USE FOR BOW!
customer_reviews.text: These do not fly good out of my sniper 370 with pile driver bolts, but fly great out of my bow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I tried them. Just ok.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, it was one of the cheapest set of three. Fit my deep six arrows and yes flys straight. However, blades nick easily. So, usually require replacement after one deer. Of course, replacement blades are available. I tend to reserve these for my longer yardage shots, 40 plus.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Good and Consistent
customer_reviews.text: Tough and reliable. Harvested 3 deer this year with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Works from a blind! Flew straight through my first buck.
customer_reviews.text: At a 61lb draw, this broadhead flew straight through my first buck and he dropped within 30yds. This was after my arrow also flew through my blind's camo mesh. Will continue to trust these in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: The Muzzy Trocar are great broad heads
customer_reviews.text: The Muzzy Trocar are great broad heads. They fly straight and you don't have to worry if they will open. They are strong and can be used over and over.
customer_reviews.author: LAW1953

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was super impressed with how this flew and held up. I have always shot wacem 4 blades.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Bell

customer_reviews.title: Works on elk
customer_reviews.text: Shot a cow elk at 50 yards. Large entry and exit wound. Good blood trail and she fell over within 40 yards. Sharpened and ready to go again. Most accurate broad head I have found out of my Matthews vertix with a 340 FMJ arrow.
customer_reviews.author: Adavis

customer_reviews.title: In my opinion best broadhead on the market
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion best broadhead on the market.. killed 2 deer with these this past year. Neither deer went more than 40 yds. Exit hole was was very impressive. They shoot the same as my 100g field points. Little to no drop at 30 yds
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: blades were chipped
customer_reviews.text: blades were chipped and looked used when I purchased it. not worth the money they were repackaged
customer_reviews.author: John schaeffer

customer_reviews.title: Great Broadhead!
customer_reviews.text: These are time tested Amazing Broadheads! Anything that I harvested with these has had a very ethical quick 🏹🦌=🥩! Thanks Muzzy!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Z.

customer_reviews.title: Best fixed blade broad-heads on the market
customer_reviews.text: You won't regret this purchase. Best fixed blade broad-heads on the market. Shoots like a field point. Taken two deer this year with these beasts. Easily went through the deer. One was a shoulder shot, went through both shoulders. Dropped instantly! Other was a bit back of the vitals, only went 35 yards. Leaves huge holes in the deer, so there going no where. Really quiet as well.
customer_reviews.author: Educator

customer_reviews.title: One Shot, One Kill.
customer_reviews.text: Used with my Barnett Recruit Recurve Crossbow. Never hunted with a crossbow before. Ten minutes in the woods and I had a nice mature doe on the ground. Later that day I put 33 lbs of meat in the freezer. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Smith

customer_reviews.title: Some orders are dull
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these twice. The first package was awesome, the second one the blades were too dull to use (may be counterfeit). They weren't slightly dull, they were incredibly dull to the point where I dare not use them.
customer_reviews.author: junotustatt

customer_reviews.title: Best value of any broadheads.
customer_reviews.text: These are tried and true. Super sharp and sturdy. If your looking to penetrate bone this and G5 Montec are best choice.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love these...full pass through on two boar at 40yds!
customer_reviews.author: N2HighVoltage

customer_reviews.title: Good tips
customer_reviews.text: Fly great. Killed and deer and a bobcat with these and did the job quite well. Huge exit wound on the deer.
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: these fly amazing. get these broadheads you wont be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: tomas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good purchase! Fast shipping! And they work great! Look forward to using them more
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Fly’s like field points
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son who’s draw weight is 50lbs. Looking for the best penetration and stable flight possible as adjusting from field points to broadheads is less than fun. These fit the bill. Fly just like his field points and as muzzy goes... leathal!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great flight. Sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Flies true to my field points. Sturdy enough for a pass thru on a shoulder shot whitetail.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: but he said they worked great!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for a friend, but he said they worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Plunk

customer_reviews.title: I will buy it again
customer_reviews.text: I’d like the accuracy and I use it for hunting
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very well built broadhead, shoots very well, muzzy's name is always one a hunter can trust.
customer_reviews.author: garman

customer_reviews.title: flies just like a field point
customer_reviews.text: flies just like a field point, penetrate well, they shoot accurately even from a very fast bow over 300 fps
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Good head for her bow.
customer_reviews.text: These are for my wife's bow, 24"- 50lb Mathews Chill SDX. They have not been used on game but are perfect size and weight for this bow.
customer_reviews.author: glm3

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Great Broadheads! Super sharp. Came in a timely manner and in the original packaging as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W

customer_reviews.title: To get a blade for it
customer_reviews.text: Opened the package today and one of the broad heads is missing a blade and screw to hold it
customer_reviews.author: Tres

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp be careful installing them
customer_reviews.text: Pinpoint accuracy! Doesn't plane out past 60 yards like other broadheads I'm not afraid to take longer shots with these broadheads if the conditions are right to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Ridgerunner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These broadheads fly great. I tried 80 yards shot right where I was aiming. Gonna hunt with this year
customer_reviews.author: jerry sittlow

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fly just like a field point. Will use these this season.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best accuracy I've found so far from a fixed blade
customer_reviews.text: Best accuracy I've found so far from a fixed blade. Taken them out to 50yds so far and gotten very similar groups with the field points
customer_reviews.author: C Apple

customer_reviews.title: the amount of blades in the listing is not correct
customer_reviews.text: The description of the replacement blades states it includes 18 blades, it only comes with 9 blades
customer_reviews.author: John Schweitzer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Extremely sharp and hit same spot as my field tips
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Maynard

customer_reviews.title: Love em
customer_reviews.text: I used to use Wac'ems but switched because of too much tuning. I love this broadheads, I have not had to adjust my sights at all when switching from my field tips.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Delvaux

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Shot deer at 25 yards it ran and dropped after 15 yards impressive!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis P.

customer_reviews.title: Great broadhead
customer_reviews.text: These are really impressive broadheads...particularly for the $$. I haven't shot a deer with these yet, but did have the opportunity to take a groundhog in my garden...they were impressive. These fly very true and were only a couple inches off from my field points. Great broadhead.
customer_reviews.author: franzelli

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bad ass broadheads. Best fixed blades you can buy fly true with good tuned bow and good blood trails
customer_reviews.author: kyle hartung

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the accuracy
customer_reviews.text: By far the most accurate broadhead I've ever used. Just like a target tip. Even at long distance of 50+ yards.
customer_reviews.author: Eric J Hartquist

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good accurate and razor sharp like a Broadhead should be
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great product works every time if you are precise !
customer_reviews.author: ElvisM

customer_reviews.title: Very good broadheads, deer ran 20 yards.
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp broadheads and they put a big triangle cut in deer. I put a bad placement on a deer at 28 yards and 100% gut shot the deer but with these broadheads my deer ran 20 yards and dropped.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: They’re accurate, durable and surgical sharp which makes them deadly,
customer_reviews.author: Steve Colao

customer_reviews.title: I'll keep
customer_reviews.text: They do what they are supposed to do. I hit a little further back on a doe (Liver Shot), but I was still able to retrieve her. The only thing wrong was that the package I received had 2 standard thread broad heads and 1 deep six broad head. Oh well, I'm pretty sure that the blades are interchangeable.
customer_reviews.author: JackHammer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like em. Flys just like my field points. Kills quickly with correct shot placement
customer_reviews.author: piers

customer_reviews.title: I always like Mussy Broadhead this is one of the best easy ...
customer_reviews.text: I always like Mussy Broadhead this is one of the best easy to tune and flies really nice.
customer_reviews.author: john pullen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: shoots with my field points out of my mathews halon...no tuning required...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Muzzy makes some of the best quality broad heads on the market
customer_reviews.text: Muzzy makes some of the best quality broad heads on the market. My step-daughter killed her first buck using a Muzzy Trocar. The broad head made a clean shot and the deer went down within 15 yards. Now she believes me that Muzzy Trocar are better than mechanical broad heads! We love our Muzzy broad heads!
customer_reviews.author: Amy D. Sward

customer_reviews.title: Love this broadhead
customer_reviews.text: Love this broadhead. Doesn't leave a blood trail, but the deer "bleed out" and never go more than 50yds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... would expect from a muzzy broadhead keep up the good work
customer_reviews.text: Everything i would expect from a muzzy broadhead keep up the good work
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Solid and fly great. I’ve been a muzzy fan for years
customer_reviews.text: Solid and fly great. I’ve been a muzzy fan for years, but never could get past the flight issues at distance. These heads solve that. Not as sturdy as the old heads, but I can put them where I want every time.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: Muzzy, PERIOD...
customer_reviews.text: always used muzzy from recurve up to crossbow. ( 68 so cross bow works best). I have a good solid 30 plus years with muzzy. Fell for some of the hype when expendable's came on the scene but they never made the grade. I have not had a chance to try this new broadhead but know it is a winner from past experience and see some new design improvements, if that is possible. Ask me again in October....
customer_reviews.author: lee rigby

customer_reviews.title: I have not shot them but the people that I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have not shot them but the people that I have talked to stated they shoot the same as a field point of the same gr.
customer_reviews.author: William D. Mckelvey

customer_reviews.title: The three deer I harvested this year I had a ...
customer_reviews.text: The three deer I harvested this year I had a total of about 50 yards of "tracking". I watch them all go down. They fly really well. There are almost no difference in my aim point with these than using field points during practice. Will buy more for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Garland R

customer_reviews.title: Straight as an arrow
customer_reviews.text: Muzzy has done it again. I Bought these broadheads a week ago and they perform as advertised. They fly true and straight without the drift you get from some other fixed blade products, even at 50 yards. These have the sharpest blades of any broadhead I've ever bought, right out of the box. Great penetration, better than the rage 3 blade heads I've been using the last couple years. The only drawback is that you don't get extra blades for target practice. I'll be buying a second set and they will be in my quiver this fall.
customer_reviews.author: WalleyeGuy

customer_reviews.title: Very loud in flight
customer_reviews.text: This is nothing like my original 3 blade MX-3's. Its very loud and I found it did not fly true when shooting my hunting setup into a block. I then purchased a pack of NAP Killzone's and they shot as good or better than my field points. This was not a good broadhead for my Mathews Creed setup.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Consumer

customer_reviews.title: This broadhead flies close to my field points, but ...
customer_reviews.text: This broadhead flies close to my field points, but the blades are a very weak. I have shot into deer without hitting bone and blades were bent or broken.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Russo

customer_reviews.title: Was disappointed for
customer_reviews.text: Did not fly true low left out of my perfectly tuned bow. Was disappointed for sure
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for my son. Have not tried them yet ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my son. Have not tried them yet. Did notice the blades are loose inside the head. As they are replaceable blades, hope they can be snugged up.
customer_reviews.author: farmfletch

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother, unless accuracy isn't important.
customer_reviews.text: They are claimed to fly true, just like field points. Not! They grab air, they steer the arrows, they fly wherever they want to. Absolutely no consistency in the flight of these heads. On the up side, they are well constructed and scary sharp.
customer_reviews.author: f.c.geil

customer_reviews.title: Total garbage. Not sure what happened to muzzy but this ...
customer_reviews.text: Total garbage. Not sure what happened to muzzy but this isn't the answer. First one I tried to put on arrow stripped out inside insert. The broadhead itself is tiny. Way way smaller than the regular 100 gr with a tiny tip on it. I bought 6 of these POS. I'll be returning the unopened package. Very disappointed in these.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissie Griggs

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Broadheads
customer_reviews.text: Ive been shooting Muzzy's for years and they always deliver great out of the box sharpness and accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

product_meta.title: Muzzy Trocar 100 Grain 3-Blade Broadhead – 3 Pack, Multi
feature_bullets: The Package Height Of The Product Is 1.25 Inches
The Package Length Of The Product Is 9.6 Inches
The Package Width Of The Product Is 5.6 Inches
Helix Blade Design for Maximum Accuracy
